items.text: To the chief Musician upon Mahalath, Maschil, A Psalm of David.
items.plainText: To the chief Musician upon Mahalath, Maschil, A Psalm of David.

items.text: The fool hath said in his heart, There is no God. Corrupt are they, and have done abominable iniquity: there is none that doeth good.
items.plainText: The fool hath said in his heart, There is no God. Corrupt are they, and have done abominable iniquity: there is none that doeth good.

items.text: God looked down from heaven upon the children of men, to see if there were any that did understand, that did seek God.
items.plainText: God looked down from heaven upon the children of men, to see if there were any that did understand, that did seek God.

items.text: Every one of them is gone back: they are altogether become filthy; there is none that doeth good, no, not one.
items.plainText: Every one of them is gone back: they are altogether become filthy; there is none that doeth good, no, not one.

items.text: Have the workers of iniquity no knowledge? who eat up my people as they eat bread: they have not called upon God.
items.plainText: Have the workers of iniquity no knowledge? who eat up my people as they eat bread: they have not called upon God.

items.text: There were they in great fear, where no fear was: for God hath scattered the bones of him that encampeth against thee: thou hast put them to shame, because God hath despised them.
items.plainText: There were they in great fear, where no fear was: for God hath scattered the bones of him that encampeth against thee: thou hast put them to shame, because God hath despised them.

items.text: Oh that the salvation of Israel were come out of Zion! When God bringeth back the captivity of his people, Jacob shall rejoice, and Israel shall be glad.
items.plainText: Oh that the salvation of Israel were come out of Zion! When God bringeth back the captivity of his people, Jacob shall rejoice, and Israel shall be glad.
